ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy

Class LocalePolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.AbstractWordPolicy
      • ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy.LocalePolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhoneticHashProvider, WordPolicy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Policy_de, Policy_en, Policy_es, Policy_fr, Policy_it

    public abstract class LocalePolicy
extends AbstractWordPolicy
    Class Object is the root of the class hierarchy. Every class has Object as a superclass. All objects, including arrays, implement the methods of this class. This abstract policy allows implementors to create a new policy with a minimum of effort. This abstract policy is the base class for locale-sensitive policies. It overrides the phonetic hashing methods to return hash codes from a PhoneticHashAlgorithm if one can be created for the locale. (Otherwise phonetic coding is unsupported.)

      • getLocale

        public abstract Locale getLocale()
        Return the locale that this policy represents.
        Returns:
        the locale reflected by this policy

      • getPhoneticHash

        public String getPhoneticHash(String word)
        Description copied from class: AbstractWordPolicy
        Return a hash code representing how a string is pronounced. This can be used to help rank spelling suggestions, so that words that sound more similar are favoured more highly.

        Policies that do not provide a phonetic hashing algorithm must throw UnsupportedOperationException. The AbstractWordPolicy implementation of this method always throws UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        getPhoneticHash in interface PhoneticHashProvider
        Specified by:
        getPhoneticHash in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        getPhoneticHash in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Parameters:
        word - the word to obtain a hash code for
        Returns:
        the phonetic hash of the word
        See Also:
        #hasPhonetics}

      • hasPhonetics

        public boolean hasPhonetics()
        Return true if this policy can perform phonetic hashing. The AbstractWordPolicy implementation of this method returns false.
        Specified by:
        hasPhonetics in interface WordPolicy
        Overrides:
        hasPhonetics in class AbstractWordPolicy
        Returns:
        true if WordPolicy.getPhoneticHash(java.lang.String) is supported
